intro: Mesanthemum platyphyllum, commonly known as the flat-leaf mesanthemum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color, blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its hardy nature and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in arid and semi-arid regions.
